titleStmt.title: Dispatch from William Walker to William H. Seward, April 23, 1861

bibl.title: Dispatch from William Walker, April 23, 1861
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

div1.opener:
To the Hon.
The Secretary of State
U.S. America.
Sir,
div1.p: I have honor to inform you that I have the keeping of some U. States property connected with the Commercial Agency of this place. It was left in my care by the late Henry A Ford M.D. and has been in the Mission Store till the present time. About one month since I opened two of the boxes to see whether the climate may have injured the contents, I only inspected them enough to know that neither climate or insects had touched them, & closed them as before. one box seemed to contain books & the other copying press. There is a third box (small) &c. a package or book in a brown paper envelope. This property is as safe as the property of the Missions of the Am. Board of Comissioner for Foreign Missions.
I write this simply to inform the Department of the condition og the property and its location.

As our latest dates from the United States are only to Feb. 6th, & not being entirely certain that your locum tenens is the City of Washington. I enclose this to a friend A. Nieribin Esqr. Bible House, Astor Place New York
